SEARCH
Package ePortfolio

Class Investment

java.lang.Object
ePortfolio.Investment
Direct Known Subclasses:
MutualFund, Stock
public abstract class Investment extends Object
Represents a generic investment in the ePortfolio system. This abstract class provides a common structure and functionality for specific types of investments such as Stocks and Mutual Funds.

  • Constructor Details

    • Investment

      public Investment(String symbol, String name, int quantity, double price) throws Exception
      Constructs a new Investment object with the specified details. Validates input to ensure all fields are properly initialized.
      Parameters:
      symbol - the unique symbol identifying the investment
      name - the name of the investment
      quantity - the quantity of the investment owned
      price - the price per unit of the investment
      Throws:
      Exception - if any parameter is invalid (e.g., empty strings or non-positive values)

  • Method Details

    • calculateBookValue

      public abstract void calculateBookValue(int quantity, double price)
      Abstract method to calculate and update the book value after a transaction. This method must be implemented by subclasses to provide specific logic.
      Parameters:
      quantity - the number of units involved in the transaction
      price - the price per unit involved in the transaction

    • payment

      public abstract double payment(int quantity)
      Abstract method to calculate the payment received after selling a quantity of the investment. This method must be implemented by subclasses to provide specific logic.
      Parameters:
      quantity - the number of units sold
      Returns:
      the total payment received

    • bValueSellC

      public void bValueSellC(int quantityOld)
      Adjusts the book value of the investment after selling a portion of it. The adjustment is proportional to the remaining quantity.
      Parameters:
      quantityOld - the quantity of the investment before selling

    • Gain

      public double Gain()
      Calculates the gain of the investment, which is the difference between the payment for the current quantity and the book value.
      Returns:
      the calculated gain
